授業目的: This is an introductory course on accounting where students will learn to use accounting information for making economic decisions. The course objective will be achieved by introducing the concepts and issues of financial accounting with an emphasis on how the economic events of an organization are identified, measured, processed, and communicated to a wide variety of users.
到達目標:
Upon successful completion of the requirements for this course, students will be able to:
a)Understand and use accounting as an information system for measuring, processing and communicating information that is useful in making economic decisions
b)Comprehend the conceptual framework of financial accounting including GAAP, IFRS, and IASB
c)Identify the accounting cycle required to prepare and use of accounting statements
d)Understand the technical competencies as well as underlying rationale for accounting practices and the effectiveness of these practices
関連科目: The course has no specific prerequisites.
授業方法:
The course will be offered in "Hy-flex" format. In"Hy-flex" format, instructor will conduct the class in a classroom, and students are able to choose whether to take the course in the classroom or online, depending on his or her own choice. For online students, classes will be held at the time specified in the timetable via interactive live streaming using Zoom. Study materials (i.e., power point slides, exercises, and home assignment) will be uploaded in LUNA one week in advance. Students are strongly encouraged to read the materials before joining the class. It would be helpful to note down the key concepts in each chapter to discuss in the class.
In each session, at first the instructor will clarify the key concepts of a chapter to the students. Then, the students will solve a number of related problems. This process will ensure that the students acquire adequate technical competencies as well as comprehend the underlying rationale and effectiveness of accounting practices.
Individual assignments will be from end-of-chapter problems. On average, students should spend 3/4 hours working on each assignment.
Mid-term report and final report: In both the reports students are required to solve some exercises related to the topics covered in the class.
Students are required to subscribe WileyPLUS, an online learning platform developed by Wiley Publishing. WileyPLUS includes pre-created assignments, quizzes, and eTextbook.
